title:
South Korea's CJ doubles down on US food market -
                        Nikkei Asia
text: Conglomerate thrives by riding the 'Korean wave' SEOUL -- South Korean food giant CJ CheilJedang is continuing its aggressive expansion into the U.S. market, with the recently announced acquisition of American frozen food maker Schwan's. This continues the moves the South Korean company has taken to snap up small and midsize food companies in the U.S. since 2005, the most expensive of which cost more than 100 billion won ($88 million). Discover the all new Nikkei Asia app Nikkei Asian Review, now known as Nikkei Asia, will be the voice of the Asian Century.
